def: To be compassionate; to show pity.I will not pity, nor spare, nor have mercy. Jer. xiii. 14.
An artificial alkaloid of complex composition, resemblingthalline and used as an antipyretic, -- whence its name.
In a politic manner; sagaciously; shrewdly; artfully. Pope.
A race Hindostan, believed to be the original people whooccupied the land before the Hindoo or Aryan invasion.

One of a series of ornaments, in the form of a frustum of acone, attached to the lower part of the triglyphs, and also to thelower faces of the mutules, in the Doric order; -- called alsocampana, and drop. Gutta serena Etym: [L., lit. serene or clear drop](Med.), amaurosis.-- Guttæ band (Arch.), the listel or band from which the guttæ hang.
A patch of granular bodies on the surface of the thallus oflichens.
The person who binds himself, or gives his bond to another.Blackstone.
One who leads a pack horse; a miller's servant. [Obs. or Local]
Wearing a helmet; furnished with or having a helmet or helmet-shaped part; galeate.
A nipple; a mammilla; a teat. Dryden.The paps which thou hast sucked. Luke xi. 27.
One who, or that which, restrains.
